ticket.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls
ticket.original-body:
When running rails in production mode (on rails 2.0.2) there are unnecessary calls to SHOW TABLES. If you view a production log file that has SQL printed out you will notice that SHOW TABLES is called multiple times per action. E.g. 07/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `users` 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `photosets` 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES
The offending code is located in
activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/mysql_adapter.rb in def tables(name - nil) ...
If you patch mysql_adapter.rb with the diff attached... SHOW TABLES will only show up once.
ticket.latest-body:
When running rails in production mode (on rails 2.0.2) there are unnecessary calls to SHOW TABLES. If you view a production log file that has SQL printed out you will notice that SHOW TABLES is called multiple times per action. E.g. 07/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `users` 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `photosets` 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES 7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES
The offending code is located in
activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/mysql_adapter.rb in def tables(name - nil) ...
If you patch mysql_adapter.rb with the diff attached... SHOW TABLES will only show up once.
ticket.original-body-html:
When running rails in production mode (on rails 2.0.2) there are unnecessary calls to SHOW TABLES. If you view a production log file that has SQL printed out you will notice that SHOW TABLES is called multiple times per action.

E.g.

07/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `users`

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `photosets`

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

The offending code is located in

activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/mysql_adapter.rb in def tables(name - nil) ...

If you patch mysql_adapter.rb with the diff attached... SHOW TABLES will only show up once.

If you view a production log file that has SQL printed out you will notice that SHOW TABLES is called multiple times per action. version.body-html:
When running rails in production mode (on rails 2.0.2) there are unnecessary calls to SHOW TABLES. If you view a production log file that has SQL printed out you will notice that SHOW TABLES is called multiple times per action.

E.g.

07/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `users`

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW FIELDS FROM `photosets`

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

7/28/08 06:01:06 PM: SHOW TABLES

The offending code is located in

activerecord/lib/active_record/connection_adapters/mysql_adapter.rb in def tables(name - nil) ...

If you patch mysql_adapter.rb with the diff attached... SHOW TABLES will only show up once.
version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body:
I believe that should be
def tables(name = nil) #:nodoc: tables = [] - execute("SHOW TABLES", name).each { |field| tables << field[0] } + execute("SHOW TABLES", name).each { |field| tables << field[0] } unless @tables + @tables ||= tables - tables + @tables end
at least that works better for me =0
version.body-html:
I believe that should be

   def tables(name = nil) #:nodoc:
     tables = []

  •  execute("SHOW TABLES", name).each { |field| tables << field[0] }

  •  execute("SHOW TABLES", name).each { |field| tables << field[0] } unless @tables

  •  @tables ||= tables

  •  tables

  •  @tables
    end

at least that works better for me =0
version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body:
Can't reproduce. Could you please also attach a failing test case ?
Thanks.
version.body-html:

version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body:
Sorry I don't really know Ruby, just trying to performance analyze an app. The last statement in the block is the return value right? In the original patch that would be "tables", which is initialized to an empty array. It's only populated if @tables is not yet cached, so after the first run, you'll be returning an empty list instead of the cached one.
Unless I'm missing something about ruby, which I probably am. And my revised patch got de-formated by the comment system =(
ta, Barry
version.body-html:
Sorry I don't really know Ruby, just trying to performance analyze an app. The last statement in the block is the return value right? In the original patch that would be "tables", which is initialized to an empty array. It's only populated if @tables is not yet cached, so after the first run, you'll be returning an empty list instead of the cached one.

Unless I'm missing something about ruby, which I probably am. And my revised patch got de-formated by the comment system =(

ta, Barry
version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body-html:
here's a similar method for not calling SHOW FIELDS every time a table is accessed, also seem to help speed.


      def columns(table_name, name = nil)#:nodoc:
        sql = "SHOW FIELDS FROM #{table_name}"
        columns = []
        @columnCache ||= {}
        execute(sql, name).each { |field| columns << MysqlColumn.new(field[0], field[4], field[1], field[2] == "YES") } unless @columnCache[table_name]
        @columnCache[table_name] ||= columns
        @columnCache[table_name]
      end

hth, Barry

version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body:
Steps to repro:
1. Install will_paginate gem. 2. Make some valid code that displays a index of records from some model. 3. Include a call to `<%= will_paginate %>` in the ERB view. 4. DO NOT call `paginate` in the controller.
Result: You will get an error like:
You have a nil object when you didn't expect it! You might have expected an instance of Array. The error occurred while evaluating nil.each
and there will be many `SHOW TABLES` calls in the log file (each one taking about 4ms in my case).
version.body-html:
Steps to repro:

  1. Install will_paginate gem.
  2. Make some valid code that displays a index of records from some model.
  3. Include a call to <%= will_paginate %> in the ERB view.
  4. DO NOT call paginate in the controller.

Result:
You will get an error like:

You have a nil object when you didn't expect it!
You might have expected an instance of Array.
The error occurred while evaluating nil.each

and there will be many SHOW TABLES calls in the log file (each one taking about 4ms in my case).

version.body-html:

version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls

version.body: Just a wild guess, but maybe it's something to do with the call to `inspect` from `debug_hash` and the `inspect` is getting called on ActiveRecord::Base (which then calls `table_exists?`).
version.body-html: Just a wild guess, but maybe it's something to do with the call to inspect from debug_hash and the inspect is getting called on ActiveRecord::Base (which then calls table_exists?).
version.title: Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls
Production mode makes many unnecessary SHOW TABLES calls
